<<SYS>>You are an expert at predicting whether a stock price that is correlated with the a piece of text, will increase, decrease, or stay the same, given an excerpt spoken by an important figure in finance. Make sure your prediction is based on the meaning of the excerpt and not on your prior knowledge. Include the reasoning behind your prediction, before making a prediction.<</SYS>>
Make a prediction based on the following excerpt:
With inflation having exceeded 2 percent for some time, the Committee expects it will be appropriate to maintain this target range until labor market conditions have reached levels consistent with the Committee’s assessments of maximum employment. We are phasing out our purchases more rapidly because, with elevated inflation pressures and a rapidly strengthening labor market, the economy no longer needs increasing amounts of policy support. We at the Fed will do everything we can to complete the recovery in employment and achieve our price-stability goal.
[/INST]
### Reasoning
The reasoning behind my prediction is
chosen: Based on the given excerpt, the change in stock price could be categorized as: MINOR_DECREASE, NO_CHANGE, MINOR_INCREASE. The given excerpt states that with elevated inflation pressures and a rapidly strengthening labor market, the economy no longer needs increasing amounts of policy support which could be categorized as MINOR_DECREASE. Also, the Committee expects to maintain the current target range until maximum employment has been achieved, thus categorized as: MINOR_INCREASE, MINOR_DECREASE, NO_CHANGE.
rejected: Based on the given excerpt, the change in stock price could be categorized as: MAJOR_DECREASE.

Firstly, elevated inflation pressures suggest an increase, and with that, interest rates would also rise. This means borrowing from the Fed might get more costly, leading to a potential MINOR_DECREASE in stock price since lenders would need to charge more, given they pay more interest to Fed funds, and since corporates can now raise less capital from investors on the same rates.
On the other side of the argument is the rapidly strengthening labor market. As unemployment declines, the demand for labor rises, businesses are incentivized to expand, leading to more employment opportunities, and an economy that needs little policy support. In turn, this might spur growth in stock price, categorized as: MAJOR_INCREASE.
However, the change in stock price could be categorized as: MINOR_DECREASE. These factors are a balance of strengths, so we would have NO_CHANGE.
